verses.text: 神藉著兒子說話　神在古時候，曾經多次用種種方法，藉著先知向我們的祖先說話；

words.note: Commonly used in religious contexts for 'through God/Christ'.
Verb-object compound: 'speak words'.
Honorific space before '神' in some Bible editions.
Commonly used in religious contexts for 'through God/Christ'.
Lit. 'one who knows first'.
Verb-object compound: 'speak words'.

verses.text: 在這末後的日子，卻藉著他的兒子向我們說話。　神已經立他作萬有的承受者，並且藉著他創造了宇宙（「宇宙」或譯：「諸世界」或「眾世代」）。

words.note: Often used in eschatological contexts.
Commonly used in religious contexts for 'through God/Christ'.
Verb-object compound: 'speak words'.
Honorific space before '神' in some Bible editions.
Used in philosophy/theology to refer to everything that exists.
Commonly used in religious contexts for 'through God/Christ'.
Literally 'space-time', referring to the whole cosmos.
Literally 'space-time', referring to the whole cosmos.
Used in Bible footnotes for alternative translations.

verses.text: 他是　神榮耀的光輝，是　神本質的真象，用自己帶有能力的話掌管萬有；他作成了潔淨罪惡的事，就坐在高天至尊者的右邊。

words.note: Honorific space before '神' in some Bible editions.
Honorific space before '神' in some Bible editions.
Used in philosophy/theology to refer to everything that exists.
Refers to the highest heavens, dwelling place of God.

verses.text: 他所承受的名比天使的名更尊貴，所以他遠比天使崇高。

words.note: Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.
Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.

verses.text: 神的兒子比天使崇高　神曾對哪一個天使說過：「你是我的兒子，我今日生了你」呢？或者說：「我要作他的父親，他要作我的兒子」呢？

words.note: Honorific space before '神' in some Bible editions.
Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.
Honorific space before '神' in some Bible editions.
Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.
Indicates a past action with experienced aspect.
More formal or archaic than '今天'.

verses.text: 神差遣長子到世上來的時候，又說：「　神所有的天使都要拜他。」

words.note: Refers to the Supreme Being, God.
Often refers to Christ in a theological context.
Connects verb phrase to noun '時候'.
The space before 神 (God) indicates respect in biblical texts.
Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.

verses.text: 論到天使，說：「　神以他的天使為風，以他的僕役為火燄。」

words.note: More formal than 僕人, often refers to religious service.

verses.text: 但是論到兒子，卻說：「　神啊！你的寶座是永永遠遠的，你國的權杖，是公平的權杖。

words.note: Functions to nominalize the preceding phrase.

verses.text: 你喜愛公義，恨惡不法，所以，　神，就是你的　神，用喜樂的油膏抹你，勝過膏抹你的同伴。」

words.note: Refers to actions against divine law.

verses.text: 又說：「主啊！你起初立了地的根基，天也是你手的工作。

words.note: Refers to God or Christ in a religious context.
Common in creation narratives.

verses.text: 天地都要毀滅，你卻長存；天地都要像衣服一樣漸漸殘舊，

words.note: Often used in a catastrophic sense.
Refers to eternal existence.
Forms 'X 像 Y 一樣' meaning 'X is like Y'.
Reduplication emphasizes gradualness.
Describes something physically deteriorated.

verses.text: 你要把天地像外套一樣捲起來，天地就像衣服一樣被更換；只有你永不改變，你的年數也沒有窮盡。」

words.note: Grammar particle indicating disposal of object.
起 indicates upward movement; 來 indicates movement toward speaker/observer.
Indicates consequence or immediacy.
Refers to having no end or limit.

verses.text: 神可曾向哪一個天使說：「你坐在我的右邊，等我使你的仇敵作你的腳凳」呢？

words.note: Used in rhetorical questions to ask 'has it ever been the case?'
Symbolizes submission and defeat of enemies.

verses.text: 天使不都是服役的靈，奉差遣為那些要承受救恩的人效勞嗎？

words.note: Combined with 不 (不都) means 'not all', 'not entirely'.
Often implies being sent with a mission or authority.
Often used for providing diligent service.
